availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Thomas McCormick (Warren County teacher and Confederate soldier)

body.p: Warren County teacher and Confederate soldier. Kentucky native. Served in 1st Kentucky Calvary Regiment, C.S.A. from 1861 to 1862. Served in Company L, 2nd Kentucky Cavalry Regiment, C.S.A. from 1862 to 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 37. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 2, p. 130. Department of Confederate Pensions (1912-1946), Application for Pension, no. 3804, http://hdl.handle.net/10602/3856 (accessed December 13, 2016). “Rev J. T. McCormick,” Find A Grave, August 9, 2012, Memorial no. 9504436. Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), Ancestry, 1917, Warren County, file no. 16615.
